mmr_immunohistochemistry.definition: Immunostaining of tumor tissue to evaluate expression of key mismatch repair proteins: MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, and PMS2.
mmr_immunohistochemistry.implication: Loss of expression of one or more proteins suggests defective mismatch repair (dMMR).
mmr_immunohistochemistry.clinical_relevance: Often used in parallel with MSI testing or as a screening tool for Lynch syndrome. Can help resolve indeterminate MSI results or cases with low tumor content.
report_language: Loss of MLH1 and PMS2 expression is consistent with MMR-deficiency
Intact MMR protein expression suggests MMR-proficient (pMMR).
mmr_immunohistochemistry.underlying_result: All four proteins show retained (normal) expression.

mmr_germline.test_name: Germline MMR Gene Testing (Hereditary Cancer Panel)
mmr_germline.definition: Sequencing of MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, PMS2, and EPCAM to identify germline mutations causing Lynch syndrome.
mmr_germline.implication: Positive results confirm inherited cancer predisposition.
mmr_germline.clinical_relevance: Required for definitive diagnosis of cancer syndromes. Guides family counseling and surveillance recommendations.
report_language: Pathogenic variant in [add specific gene] detected is consistent with Lynch syndrome.
No pathogenic variant detected does not rule out all causes of MSI-H/dMMR.
Variants of Uncertain Significance (VUS) detected may require further study or family testing.
mmr_germline.underlying_result: Individual variant calls and classifications for these 4 genes (sometimes other combinations also)
